questions.questionLabel: What is a component in Angular?

How do you create a new Angular application?
What is data binding in Angular, and what are the different types of data binding?

answers.answerLabel: A reusable building block for the user interface
A style in Angular
A service for handling HTTP requests
A routing configuration
NgModule is used to declare and configure modules in Angular applications.
NgModule is a component in Angular.
NgModule is used for data binding in Angular.
NgModule is a directive in Angular.
You can create a new Angular application using the Angular CLI by running 'ng new app-name'.
You can create a new Angular application by writing HTML and CSS files.
You can create a new Angular application using pure JavaScript.
You can create a new Angular application using Python.
Data binding in Angular is a mechanism for synchronizing data between the component and the view.
Data binding in Angular is used for creating components.
Data binding in Angular is a routing feature.
Data binding in Angular is only available for services.
{{}} (interpolation) is used for displaying dynamic data in the template.
[property] (property binding) is used for displaying dynamic data in the template.
{{}} (interpolation) is used for creating CSS styles.
[property] (property binding) is used for creating services.
Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine that allows server-side scripting.
Node.js is a frontend framework for building web applications.
Node.js is a CSS preprocessor.
Node.js is a database management system.
Asynchronous operations in Node.js are handled using callbacks, promises, or async/await.
Asynchronous operations in Node.js are handled using synchronous blocking code.
Asynchronous operations in Node.js are only handled using event emitters.
Asynchronous operations in Node.js cannot be handled natively.
Node.js modules are reusable code packages that can be included in an application using require() or import.
Node.js modules are built-in tools for handling HTTP requests.
Node.js modules are only available in the npm registry.
Node.js modules are used for configuring environment variables.
The package.json file is used to manage the projectâ€™s dependencies and metadata like the project name, version, and scripts.
The package.json file is used to store environment variables.
The package.json file is used to compile JavaScript code.
The package.json file is a configuration file for the Node.js server.
Dependencies in a Node.js application are managed using npm or yarn to install, update, and remove packages.
Dependencies in a Node.js application are managed manually by downloading and linking files.
Dependencies in a Node.js application are automatically included by the Node.js runtime.
Dependencies in a Node.js application are managed using environment variables.
